item.title: Sr Database Modeler/Database Development Consultant
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Remote Banking & Shared Services provides modern software driven banking experiences for CIBC\'s personal and small business banking clients by putting our clients at the center of all that we do .You’ll be at the heart of CIBC’s digital transformation, successfully delivering complex, enterprise-scale projects.

As a Sr. Data Modeler you will translate business needs into Logical data models supporting long-term solutions and work with the Application Development team to implement data strategies, build data flows and develop conceptual data models. You will create logical data model using best practices to ensure high data quality and reduced redundancy and optimize and update logical data models to support new and existing projects as well as maintain conceptual, logical and physical data models along with corresponding metadata.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Develop best practices for standard naming conventions and coding practices to ensure consistency of data models.

  • Recommend opportunities for reuse of data models in new environment and perform reverse engineering of physical data models from databases and SQL scripts.

  • Analyze data-related system integration challenges and propose appropriate solutions and develop data models according to company standards.

  • Relationship Building- Strong relationship with all technology partners required  with professional high quality team building for the assigned portfolio. You will liaise and interact with Architects, Solution design, Development and QA as part of the daily management of the portfolio.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate 5+ years of experience as a Data Modeler who is proficient in LDM, PM, SQL, Oracle. You have a solid experience in evaluating data models and physical databases for variances and discrepancies and validate business data objects for accuracy and completeness.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information.

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making

  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-20 Dundas St. W., 6th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Cloud Consultant - Big Data
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

In this role, you will join the CIBC’s Big Data team in a Senior Cloud Consultant capacity and you will provide subject matter expertise to Big Data Cloud initiatives as they relate to the design, implementation and support of Azure cloud technologies and tooling.  This role will  require good knowledge on CIBC Cloud offerings and will be representing the big data team in the Cloud Design Authority forum.  As a member of CIBC’s Big Data team you will provide technical leadership, standards, best practices, review and support with TO requirements to Big Data Project teams during design, build, configuration, implementation and maintenance phases of the Cloud projects. You will work closely with other Big Data tech leads to provide guidance on Cloud project implementations.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Leadership & Communication – Collaborate with senior leaders and tech leads across the team and make informed recommendations to enhance Big Data related solutions. Weigh business needs against technology offerings, security concerns and CIBC roadmap to provide solution recommendations which are practical and achievable.

  • Develop & Design – Lead or coach the design and development of Big Data projects in Cloud

  • Solution Design: Promote awareness and understanding of solutions being proposed by attending project and program meetings, influencing planning, designing, leading and facilitating forums and discussions with business partners, designers, architects, developers and vendors as needed. Attend TO Requirements sessions and help bridge the gap between the application delivery team and the TO Solutioning team.

  • Mentor and Coach – Mentor and Coach tech leads and developers on best cloud practices at CIBC and help bridge the gap on cross tech team collaboration.

  • Managing Multiple Priorities: Manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects or activities. Effective judgment in prioritizing and time allocation. Ability to process information with high levels of accuracy.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience :       

    • 4+  years of hands-on expertise with Azure or other Cloud provider technologies. It’s an asset if you have relevant Azure certifications such as AZ-203, AZ-303, AZ-304, AZ-400 or equivalent knowledge.

    • 2 years hands on experience with Data Cloud services such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks,  Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Blob, SQL Server

    • Good knowledge of Azure Devops, Azure Monitor, Azure Synapse (Formerly SQL Data Warehouse), Azure Data Catalogue/Purview, CosmosDB.

    • Good knowledge of Azure Identity and Access management (RBAC, AAD, SPN).

    • It’s an asset if you have hands on working experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Oozie, HiveQL, Hive UDFs, Sqoop, Spark, Impala.

    • It’s an asset if you have hands-on development expertise with Core Java or Scala as well as Python and SQL.

  • You’re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends. You are passionate about technology.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success.  You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You are passionate about client service - You want the work you do each day to result in a positive client experience.

  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning.

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-55 Yonge Street, 3rd

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Senior Director, Data Governance and Business Technology
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Vice President Commercial Solutions, as the Senior Director, you will have overall responsibility to establish, build and manage a Centre of Excellence for Commercial Banking data governance and oversee some of the Commercial Banking technology applications.

You will be responsible for developing an integrated data strategy for CIBC Commercial Banking with a view towards building and managing a strong data foundation for the business. This will include but not be limited to enhancing the existing data quality within the business, building external data integration, establishing rigor around master data management and building near real-time data access. A strong data foundation is critical to ensure the business maximizes value from existing and future technology investments for all stakeholders in terms of business insights and will support strategic priorities around pricing, client experience, decision optimization and predictive analysis & cognitive intelligence.

Working with Commercial Banking technology and product groups, you will provide  guidance, strategic direction and leadership relative to the management of certain existing technology applications  and development and implementation of some new technology applications. Our vision is to become the leading commercial bank in Canada and you will play a key role in ensuring that appropriate technology applications are available to drive superior client experience and help achieve this vision.

How You\'ll Succeed

  • You will lead development of an integrated data strategy for  CIBC Commercial Banking. This would involve mapping the current state of data within the business and creation of a  data roadmap for the future that would align with the strategic direction of our business. The data strategy will include but not be limited to enhancing the existing data quality within the business, building external data integration, establishing rigor around master data management and building near real-time data access.
  • In conjunction with Commercial Banking technology and product groups, you will provide leadership with respect to the management and enhancement of certain existing technology applications including ensuring that these technology applications  are managed and upgraded in a timely manner.
  • You will work with the technology and relevant product teams,  ensure timely and on-budget execution of new technology applications within the business which will drive superior client experience within CIBC Commercial Banking.
  • You will provide  stewardship to ensure integrity of Commercial Banking data across all managed technology  applications and build a strong and sustainable data foundation within the business.
  • In partnership with the Enterprise data team, you will establish and maintain a strong data governance structure within Commercial Banking to ensure proper oversight over data creation, management and sharing.
  • You will build out data analytic capabilities within CIBC Commercial Banking and ensure that  appropriate data is available to relevant stakeholders, both internal and external, in a format that is valuable.
  • You will foster relationships with key business partners and stakeholders to ensure that the business is well positioned to achieve the business and financial objectives.  
  • You will serve as a subject matter expert for CIBC Commercial Banking data and technology applications managed by the team  and be a sounding board to internal partners for new business ideas or insights on data and managed technology capabilities.  
  • You will develop strong relationships with industry associations and peers at competitor organizations to stay abreast of changing industry trends and competitor activity which could impact Commercial Banking technology or data capabilities.
  • You will provide leadership and effective management of business unit staff to influence employee commitment to the organization, to the team, and to their job by:
  • Hiring the right people in the right jobs to align individual capabilities with job requirements and business unit goals.
  • Setting appropriate context when assigning work to ensure that individuals’ roles support the achievement of the business unit’s priorities and CIBC’s overall goals.
  • Building team and individual capabilities by providing development opportunities such as job shadowing, special projects, and training.
  • Managing performance by providing fair and accurate formal and informal feedback, identifying and removing obstacles to performance and by explaining how performance expectations align with business priorities.
  • Creating a positive work environment and being an effective role model by championing CIBC’s mission, vision and values.
  • Ensuring compliance with policies, standards, guidelines and controls by applying the policies and controls fairly and consistently so employees understand what to expect.  

Who You Are

  • You have experience in domestic/international financial services industry with a good understanding of commercial banking business. You have business, technology and product development orientation.
  • You are solutions oriented. You have a demonstrated ability to understand complex problems and to formulate solutions. You have an excellent ability to gather, synthesize, organize and interpret data and information to formulate insights, options, and recommendations.
  • You are a strong collaborator. You have the ability to work closely with a wide and diverse range of groups and functional disciplines.
  • You have influential skills sufficient to compel diverse groups to align to common goals that involve matters of business strategy.
  • You have leadership and people management skills sufficient to motivate a team faced with significant change while contributing to business objectives.
  • You have developed project planning skills sufficient to prioritize projects and ensure team meets project deadlines.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-CC West 4th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5
